byline.contributor: Nick Corasaniti reported from Charleston, Richard Pérez-Peña from New York and Lizette Alvarez from Miami. Reporting was contributed by John Eligon, Jason Horowitz, Jonathan Weisman and Alan Blinder from Charleston, Michael S. Schmidt and Michael D. Shear from Washington, and Jonathan M. Katz from Kings Mountain, N.C..
byline.original: By NICK CORASANITI, RICHARD PÉREZ-PEÑA and LIZETTE ALVAREZ

abstract: Police arrest 21-year-old white man Dylann Storm Roof as suspect in shooting massacre of nine people in Emanuel African Methodist Episcopal Church in Charleston, SC; murders, which are being investigated as hate crime, leave people stunned and grieving; whites, blacks, Jews and Christians unite in city to declare that racist gunman will not split a proud community.
lead_paragraph: After a 14-hour search, the suspect was caught some 200 miles away from the historic black church where nine people were killed.

headline.main: Church Massacre Suspect Held as Charleston Grieves
headline.print_headline: Charleston Massacre Suspect Held as City Grieves
headline.sub: Attack Is Called a Hate Crime

snippet: After a 14-hour search, the suspect was caught some 200 miles away from the historic black church where nine people were killed.
